description: Number of 3-dimensional integer direction vectors (a,b,c) towards grid points at squared integer distance 2n-1 with a >= 0, b >= 0, c >= 0.
comments: A vector is a direction vector if its nonzero components have their GCD = 1.
example: The 4 directions towards points at squared distance 29 (i.e. for n=15) are (signed permutations of) [ 24,16,3 ],[ 24,12,11 ],[ 21,20,0 ],[ 21,16,12 ]
author: _Wouter Meeussen_
